channel.title: Stories from designyoutrust.com - Digg
channel.description: Archive of the best designyoutrust.com stories on Digg including articles, videos, and photos

item.title: A Gallery Of Stunning Photos Of Classic Range Rover Conversions
item.description: The Range Rover has been a notable part of motoring since the beginning of the 1970s.

item.title: This Graffiti-Covered Abandoned Highway In Pennsylvania Looks Like A Scene From A Horror Movie
item.description: There's something eerily beautiful about abandoned places — they look surprisingly calm yet still manage to make you feel as if someone's watching you.

item.title: Amazing Vintage Photos Of The Grateful Dead's Wall Of Sound, 1974
item.description: The Wall of Sound was an enormous public address system designed specifically for the Grateful Dead's live performances in 1974. And it was… insane.

item.title: Amazing Photographs Documented Victorian Houses Moving In San Francisco In The 1970s
item.description: There was once a time when San Francisco's Victorian architecture was not as highly respected and esteemed as it is today.

item.title: The Worst Book Covers On Amazon
item.description: Who needs a professional designer when you can save money and make a book cover by yourself, right? Wrong.

item.title: Stunning Photos From The Bosch Parade, The Sailing Parade In The Spirit Of Jheronimus Bosch
item.description: This floating, poetic parade of art works portrays a universal tale of power and counterforce, battle and rapprochement, chaos and hope.

item.title: Someone Found An Old Photo Album Full Of Pics Of This Woman And Hollywood Celebrities In A Thrift Shop
item.description: A thrift shop in Belgium has caused quite a stir on the Internet.

item.title: A Russian Cosmonaut's Entrancing Photos Of Earth From Space
item.description: Fyodor Yurchikhin has flown to space three times and managed to take amazing pictures from there.

item.title: Photographer Tracks Down People He Snapped In His Hometown Almost 40 Years Ago To Recreate The Remarkable Images
item.description: Paramedic Chris Porsz spent hours walking around the city of Peterborough, Cambridgeshire (Great Britain) in the late 1970s and 80s, taking candid shots of punks and policemen, siblings and sweethearts, traders and teenagers. 40 years later, he sought out the subjects to photograph them again.

item.title: The Psychology of Colors in Logo Design
item.description: Color psychology has been analyzed by psychiatrists for quite some time.

item.title: Return of the Cicadas
item.description: A documentary film that looks at the most fascinating insects on Earth. item.title: Photographer Gives Lollipop Then Takes It Away
item.description: Jill Greenberg "The Manipulator" is one of the more popular photographers of her era, however she is also one of the most controversial ones too.

item.title: Conceptual "Cut Food" Photography by Beth Galton
item.description: A visual collaboration between the photographer Beth Galton & food stylist Charlotte Omnes, and it's called "Cut Food" and it features a look at food in a way you normally would not see it.

item.title: Hydroptere – World's fastest Sailboat
item.description:
Hydroptere sailboat the fastest sailing boat in the world, will attempt to set the record of the transpacific crossing between Los Angeles and Honolulu.    Have a look at the video…

item.title: Upside-Down Self Portraits by Photographer Caulton Morris
item.description: British photographer Caulton Morris places himself in awkward body positions and odd scenarios for his delightful self-portrait photography.

item.title: 30 Shots Infographic
item.description: Is it an infographic, or a recipe list? Either way, this poster shows what's inside 30 of the most popular and iconic shooters.

item.title: Famous Self-Portraits
item.description: Here are some famous-self portraits photoshopped to look like selfies.

item.title: The Cost of Powering the Internet
item.description: The cost of powering the Internet, which is 1.5% of global electricity, is 8.5 billion dollars annually.
